## Chronic Conditions

### SEM Results

```{r model-totcams-chron, echo = FALSE, results='hide', fig.show='hide'}
model <- '
# Regressions
# Direct effect - log income 
totalCams_W3 ~ a*LogIncome_W1 
SumChron_W3 ~ b*LogIncome_W1
# Direct Effect - Education
totalCams_W3 ~ c*Education_W1
SumChron_W3 ~ d*Education_W1
# Mediator effects - Income 
SumChron_W2 ~ e*LogIncome_W1 
totalCams_W3 ~ f*SumChron_W2
totalCams_W2 ~ g*LogIncome_W1
SumChron_W3 ~ h*totalCams_W2
# Mediator effects - Education
totalCams_W2 ~ i*Education_W1
SumChron_W2 ~ j*Education_W1 
# Control for previous wave
totalCams_W3 ~ totalCams_W2
SumChron_W3 ~ SumChron_W2
# Indirect effect 
ef := e*f
gh := g*h
jf := j*f
ih := i*h
# total effect
total1 := a + (e*f)
total2 := b + (g*h)
total3 := c + (j*f)
total4 := d + (i*h)
# Controls
totalCams_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + HlthInsurance_W2 + HLSelf_W2 + Spiritual_W2 + Religion_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
SumChron_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
totalCams_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + HlthInsurance_W3 + HLSelf_W3 + Spiritual_W3 + Religion_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
SumChron_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
# Covariances
totalCams_W2 ~~ SumChron_W2
totalCams_W3 ~~ SumChron_W3
'


# Run model and get summary and fit statistics
set.seed(1234)
model.summ <- sem(model, data = path.complete, se = "bootstrap")
summary(model.summ, standardized = TRUE, fit.measures = TRUE)
fitMeasures(model.summ.2, c("cfi", "rmsea", "srmr"))
#modificationindices(model.summ)

# Create object with model fit measures
fit.totcams.chron <- lavInspect(model.summ, what = "fit")

# Create object with parameter estimates
est.totcams.chron <- parameterEstimates(model.summ, boot.ci.type = "bca.simple", standardized = TRUE)


m <- matrix(NA, 4, 3)
m[1, 1] <- "LogIncome_W1"
m[4, 1] <- "Education_W1"
m[2, 2] <- "totalCams_W2"
m[3, 2] <- "SumChron_W2"
m[1, 3] <- "totalCams_W3"
m[4, 3] <- "SumChron_W3"

# Drop controls from path diagram
path_dia <- semptools::drop_nodes(
                object = semPlotModel(model.summ),
                nodes = c("Age_W3", "Sex_W1", "Marital_W3", "HlthInsurance_W3", "HLSelf_W3", "Spiritual_W3", "Religion_W3", "MexicanHispanic_W2", "Black_W2", "OtherRace_W2", "Age_W2", "Marital_W2", "HlthInsurance_W2", "HLSelf_W2", "Spiritual_W2", "Religion_W2"))

# Create path diagram
path_dia2 <- semPaths(path_dia, whatLabels = "std",
           sizeMan = 8,
           edge.label.cex = .8,
           edge.color = "black",
           style = "ram",
           layout = m, 
           exoCov = FALSE,
           nCharNodes = 0, nCharEdges = 0)

# Create list to rearrange positions of node edges that were blocking each other
my_position_list <- c("totalCams_W3 ~ Education_W1" = .20, 
                      "SumChron_W3 ~ LogIncome_W1" = .75)
# Change label position
path_dia3 <- set_edge_label_position(path_dia2, my_position_list)

path_dia4 <- change_node_label(path_dia3,
                           c(LogIncome_W1 = "Income W1",
                             Education_W1 = "Education W1",
                             totalCams_W2 = "Total CAMs W2",
                             SumChron_W2 = "Sum Chron W2", 
                             totalCams_W3 = "Total CAMs W3",
                             SumChron_W3 = "Sum Chron W3"),
                           label.cex = 1.1)

path_dia5 <- mark_sig(path_dia4, model.summ, alpha = c("(n.s.)" = 1.00, "*" = .05))

```

```{r path-totcams-chron, echo = FALSE, fig.cap="Path Model: SES, Total CAMs, and Chronic Conditions"}
plot(path_dia5)
```

### GSEM Results

```{stata, include=FALSE}
use path.dta, clear

# remove uppercase from variables
rename (LogIncome_W1 Education_W1 Sex_W1 SumChron_W2 Age_W2 Marital_W2 HlthInsurance_W2 HLSelf_W2 Spiritual_W2 Religion_W2 MexicanHispanic_W2 Black_W2 OtherRace_W2 SumChron_W3 Age_W3 Marital_W3 HlthInsurance_W3 HLSelf_W3 Spiritual_W3 Religion_W3) (logincome_W1 education_W1 sex_W1 sumchron_W2 age_W2 marital_W2 hlthinsurance_W2 hlself_W2 spiritual_W2 religion_W2 mexicanhispanic_W2 black_W2 otherrace_W2 sumchron_W3 age_W3 marital_W3 hlthinsurance_W3 hlself_W3 spiritual_W3 religion_W3)

rename(totalCams_W2 totalCams_W3)(totalcams_W2 totalcams_W3)

rename(SRH_W2 SRH_W3)(srh_W2 srh_W3)

set seed 1234

# Run gsem
gsem(totalcams_W2 <- logincome_W1 education_W1 sex_W1 age_W2 marital_W2 hlthinsurance_W2 hlself_W2 spiritual_W2 religion_W2 mexicanhispanic_W2 black_W2 otherrace_W2, poisson) (sumchron_W2 <- logincome_W1 education_W1 sex_W1 age_W2 marital_W2 hlthinsurance_W2 hlself_W2 mexicanhispanic_W2 black_W2 otherrace_W2, poisson) (totalcams_W3 <- logincome_W1 education_W1 sumchron_W2 totalcams_W2 age_W3 sex_W1 marital_W3 hlthinsurance_W3 hlself_W3 spiritual_W3 religion_W3 mexicanhispanic_W2 black_W2 otherrace_W2, poisson) (sumchron_W3 <- logincome_W1 education_W1 sumchron_W2 totalcams_W2 age_W3 sex_W1 marital_W3 hlthinsurance_W3 hlself_W3 mexicanhispanic_W2 black_W2 otherrace_W2, poisson), post
```

## Self-Reported Health 

### SEM Results

```{r model-totcams-SRH, echo = FALSE, results='hide', fig.show='hide'}
model <- '
# Regressions
# Direct effect - log income 
totalCams_W3 ~ a*LogIncome_W1 
SRH_W3 ~ b*LogIncome_W1
# Direct Effect - Education
totalCams_W3 ~ c*Education_W1
SRH_W3 ~ d*Education_W1
# Mediator effects - Income 
SRH_W2 ~ e*LogIncome_W1 
totalCams_W3 ~ f*SRH_W2
totalCams_W2 ~ g*LogIncome_W1
SRH_W3 ~ h*totalCams_W2
# Mediator effects - Education
totalCams_W2 ~ i*Education_W1
SRH_W2 ~ j*Education_W1 
# Control for previous wave
totalCams_W3 ~ totalCams_W2
SRH_W3 ~ SRH_W2
# Indirect effect 
ef := e*f
gh := g*h
jf := j*f
ih := i*h
# total effect
total1 := a + (e*f)
total2 := b + (g*h)
total3 := c + (j*f)
total4 := d + (i*h)
# Controls
totalCams_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + HlthInsurance_W2 + HLSelf_W2 + Spiritual_W2 + Religion_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
SRH_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
totalCams_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + HlthInsurance_W3 + HLSelf_W3 + Spiritual_W3 + Religion_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
SRH_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
# Covariances
totalCams_W2 ~~ SRH_W2
totalCams_W3 ~~ SRH_W3
'

# Run model and get summary and fit statistics
set.seed(1234)
model.summ <- sem(model, data = path.complete, se = "bootstrap")
summary(model.summ, standardized = TRUE, fit.measures = TRUE)
fitMeasures(model.summ, c("cfi", "rmsea", "srmr"))
#modificationindices(model.summ)

# Create object with model fit measures
fit.totcams.SRH <- lavInspect(model.summ, what = "fit")

# Create object with parameter estimates
est.totcams.SRH <- parameterEstimates(model.summ, boot.ci.type = "bca.simple", standardized = TRUE)


m <- matrix(NA, 4, 3)
m[1, 1] <- "LogIncome_W1"
m[4, 1] <- "Education_W1"
m[2, 2] <- "totalCams_W2"
m[3, 2] <- "SRH_W2"
m[1, 3] <- "totalCams_W3"
m[4, 3] <- "SRH_W3"

# Drop controls from path diagram
path_dia <- semptools::drop_nodes(
                object = semPlotModel(model.summ),
                nodes = c("Age_W3", "Sex_W1", "Marital_W3", "HlthInsurance_W3", "HLSelf_W3", "Spiritual_W3", "Religion_W3", "MexicanHispanic_W2", "Black_W2", "OtherRace_W2", "Age_W2", "Marital_W2", "HlthInsurance_W2", "HLSelf_W2", "Spiritual_W2", "Religion_W2"))

# Create path diagram
path_dia2 <- semPaths(path_dia, whatLabels = "std",
           sizeMan = 8,
           edge.label.cex = .8,
           edge.color = "black",
           style = "ram",
           layout = m, 
           exoCov = FALSE,
           nCharNodes = 0, nCharEdges = 0)

# Create list to rearrange positions of node edges that were blocking each other
my_position_list <- c("totalCams_W3 ~ Education_W1" = .20, 
                      "SRH_W3 ~ LogIncome_W1" = .75)
# Change label position
path_dia3 <- set_edge_label_position(path_dia2, my_position_list)

path_dia4 <- change_node_label(path_dia3,
                           c(LogIncome_W1 = "Income W1",
                             Education_W1 = "Education W1",
                             totalCams_W2 = "Total CAMs W2",
                             SRH_W2 = "SRH W2", 
                             totalCams_W3 = "Total CAMs W3",
                             SRH_W3 = "SRH W3"),
                           label.cex = 1.1)

path_dia5 <- mark_sig(path_dia4, model.summ, alpha = c("(n.s.)" = 1.00, "*" = .05))
```

## Diabetes 

### SEM Results 

```{r model-totcams-diabetes, echo = FALSE, results='hide', fig.show='hide'}
model <- '
# Regressions
# Direct effect - log income 
totalCams_W3 ~ a*LogIncome_W1 
Diabetes_W3 ~ b*LogIncome_W1
# Direct Effect - Education
totalCams_W3 ~ c*Education_W1
Diabetes_W3 ~ d*Education_W1
# Mediator effects - Income 
Diabetes_W2 ~ e*LogIncome_W1 
totalCams_W3 ~ f*Diabetes_W2
totalCams_W2 ~ g*LogIncome_W1
Diabetes_W3 ~ h*totalCams_W2
# Mediator effects - Education
totalCams_W2 ~ i*Education_W1
Diabetes_W2 ~ j*Education_W1 
# Control for previous wave
totalCams_W3 ~ totalCams_W2
Diabetes_W3 ~ Diabetes_W2
# Indirect effect 
ef := e*f
gh := g*h
jf := j*f
ih := i*h
# total effect
total1 := a + (e*f)
total2 := b + (g*h)
total3 := c + (j*f)
total4 := d + (i*h)
# Controls
totalCams_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + HlthInsurance_W2 + HLSelf_W2 + Spiritual_W2 + Religion_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
Diabetes_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
totalCams_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + HlthInsurance_W3 + HLSelf_W3 + Spiritual_W3 + Religion_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
Diabetes_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
# Covariances
totalCams_W2 ~~ Diabetes_W2
totalCams_W3 ~~ Diabetes_W3
'

# Run model and get summary and fit statistics
set.seed(1234)
model.summ <- sem(model, data = path.complete, se = "bootstrap")
summary(model.summ, standardized = TRUE, fit.measures = TRUE)
fitMeasures(model.summ, c("cfi", "rmsea", "srmr"))
#modificationindices(model.summ)

# Create object with model fit measures
fit.totcams.diabetes <- lavInspect(model.summ, what = "fit")

# Create object with parameter estimates
est.totcams.diabetes <- parameterEstimates(model.summ, boot.ci.type = "bca.simple", standardized = TRUE)


m <- matrix(NA, 4, 3)
m[1, 1] <- "LogIncome_W1"
m[4, 1] <- "Education_W1"
m[2, 2] <- "totalCams_W2"
m[3, 2] <- "Diabetes_W2"
m[1, 3] <- "totalCams_W3"
m[4, 3] <- "Diabetes_W3"

# Drop controls from path diagram
path_dia <- semptools::drop_nodes(
                object = semPlotModel(model.summ),
                nodes = c("Age_W3", "Sex_W1", "Marital_W3", "HlthInsurance_W3", "HLSelf_W3", "Spiritual_W3", "Religion_W3", "MexicanHispanic_W2", "Black_W2", "OtherRace_W2", "Age_W2", "Marital_W2", "HlthInsurance_W2", "HLSelf_W2", "Spiritual_W2", "Religion_W2"))

# Create path diagram
path_dia2 <- semPaths(path_dia, whatLabels = "std",
           sizeMan = 8,
           edge.label.cex = .8,
           edge.color = "black",
           style = "ram",
           layout = m, 
           exoCov = FALSE,
           nCharNodes = 0, nCharEdges = 0)

# Create list to rearrange positions of node edges that were blocking each other
my_position_list <- c("totalCams_W3 ~ Education_W1" = .20, 
                      "Diabetes_W3 ~ LogIncome_W1" = .75)
# Change label position
path_dia3 <- set_edge_label_position(path_dia2, my_position_list)

path_dia4 <- change_node_label(path_dia3,
                           c(LogIncome_W1 = "Income W1",
                             Education_W1 = "Education W1",
                             totalCams_W2 = "Total CAMs W2",
                             Diabetes_W2 = "Diabetes W2", 
                             totalCams_W3 = "Total CAMs W3",
                             Diabetes_W3 = "Diabetes W3"),
                           label.cex = 1.1)

path_dia5 <- mark_sig(path_dia4, model.summ, alpha = c("(n.s.)" = 1.00, "*" = .05))

```

```{r model-totcams-chronicpain, echo = FALSE, results='hide', fig.show='hide'}
ChronicPain_W3 ~ d*Education_W1
# Mediator effects - Income 
ChronicPain_W2 ~ e*LogIncome_W1 
totalCams_W3 ~ f*ChronicPain_W2
totalCams_W2 ~ g*LogIncome_W1
ChronicPain_W3 ~ h*totalCams_W2
# Mediator effects - Education
totalCams_W2 ~ i*Education_W1
ChronicPain_W2 ~ j*Education_W1 
# Control for previous wave
totalCams_W3 ~ totalCams_W2
ChronicPain_W3 ~ ChronicPain_W2
# Indirect effect 
ef := e*f
gh := g*h
jf := j*f
ih := i*h
# total effect
total1 := a + (e*f)
total2 := b + (g*h)
total3 := c + (j*f)
total4 := d + (i*h)
# Controls
totalCams_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + HlthInsurance_W2 + HLSelf_W2 + Spiritual_W2 + Religion_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
ChronicPain_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
totalCams_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + HlthInsurance_W3 + HLSelf_W3 + Spiritual_W3 + Religion_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
ChronicPain_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
# Covariances
totalCams_W2 ~~ ChronicPain_W2
totalCams_W3 ~~ ChronicPain_W3
'

# Run model and get summary and fit statistics
set.seed(1234)
model.summ <- sem(model, data = path.complete, se = "bootstrap")
summary(model.summ, standardized = TRUE, fit.measures = TRUE)
fitMeasures(model.summ, c("cfi", "rmsea", "srmr"))
#modificationindices(model.summ)

# Create object with model fit measures
fit.totcams.chronicpain <- lavInspect(model.summ, what = "fit")

# Create object with parameter estimates
est.totcams.chronicpain <- parameterEstimates(model.summ, boot.ci.type = "bca.simple", standardized = TRUE)


m <- matrix(NA, 4, 3)
m[1, 1] <- "LogIncome_W1"
m[4, 1] <- "Education_W1"
m[2, 2] <- "totalCams_W2"
m[3, 2] <- "ChronicPain_W2"
m[1, 3] <- "totalCams_W3"
m[4, 3] <- "ChronicPain_W3"

# Drop controls from path diagram
path_dia <- semptools::drop_nodes(
                object = semPlotModel(model.summ),
                nodes = c("Age_W3", "Sex_W1", "Marital_W3", "HlthInsurance_W3", "HLSelf_W3", "Spiritual_W3", "Religion_W3", "MexicanHispanic_W2", "Black_W2", "OtherRace_W2", "Age_W2", "Marital_W2", "HlthInsurance_W2", "HLSelf_W2", "Spiritual_W2", "Religion_W2"))

# Create path diagram
path_dia2 <- semPaths(path_dia, whatLabels = "std",
           sizeMan = 8,
           edge.label.cex = .8,
           edge.color = "black",
           style = "ram",
           layout = m, 
           exoCov = FALSE,
           nCharNodes = 0, nCharEdges = 0)

# Create list to rearrange positions of node edges that were blocking each other
my_position_list <- c("totalCams_W3 ~ Education_W1" = .20, 
                      "ChronicPain_W3 ~ LogIncome_W1" = .75)
# Change label position
path_dia3 <- set_edge_label_position(path_dia2, my_position_list)

path_dia4 <- change_node_label(path_dia3,
                           c(LogIncome_W1 = "Income W1",
                             Education_W1 = "Education W1",
                             totalCams_W2 = "Total CAMs W2",
                             ChronicPain_W2 = "Chronic Pain W2", 
                             totalCams_W3 = "Total CAMs W3",
                             ChronicPain_W3 = "Chronic Pain W3"),
                           label.cex = 1.1)

path_dia5 <- mark_sig(path_dia4, model.summ, alpha = c("(n.s.)" = 1.00, "*" = .05))

```

The path diagram depicting the relationships between SES, total CAMs used, and chronic pain can be seen in Figure \ref{fig:path-totcams-chronicpain}. Results from the SEM analysis can be found in Tables \ref{tab:de-totcams-chronicpain}, \ref{tab:ie-totcams-chronicpain}, and \ref{tab:fit-totcams-chronicpain}. Results from the GSEM analysis can be found in Tables \ref{tab:de-gsem-totcams-chronicpain} and \ref{tab:ie-gsem-totcams-chronicpain}. Model fit indices indicate overall good model fit (CFI = `r round(fit.totcams.chronicpain[9], 3)`; TLI = `r round(fit.totcams.chronicpain[10], 3)`; RMSEA = `r round(fit.totcams.chronicpain[23],3)`; SRMR = `r round(fit.totcams.chronicpain[29],3)`; \$\\chi\$^2^(`r round(fit.totcams.chronicpain[4], 3)`)=`r round(fit.totcams.chronicpain[3], 3)`, *p* \<.001.).

Income at wave 1 is negatively related to chronic pain at wave 2 in the SEM analysis (*b* = -0.032, 95% CI: -0.058, -0.005, *p* \< 0.050) but not the GSEM analysis. Neither analysis shows a significant association between income at wave 1 and chronic pain at wave 3. Similarly, income is not related to total CAMs used at wave 3. 

Education at wave 1 is negatively related to chronic pain at wave 3 (SEM: *b* = -0.023, 95% CI: -0.041, -0.002, *p* \< 0.050; GSEM: *b* = -0.095, 95% CI: -0.186, -0.004, *p* \< 0.050). Education is positively related to total CAMs used at wave 2 (SEM: *b* = 0.275, 95% CI: 0.197, 0.350, *p* \< 0.001; GSEM: *b* = 0.139, 95% CI: 0.110, 0.168, *p* \< 0.001). Total CAMs at wave 2 is positively related to chronic pain at wave 3 (SEM: *b* = 0.011, 95% CI: 0.001, 0.021, *p* \< 0.050; GSEM: *b* = 0.058, 95% CI: 0.010, 0.106, *p* \< 0.050). Results from the GSEM show a significant positive indirect effect for education on chronic pain via total CAMs (*b* = 0.008, 95% CI: 0.001, 0.015, *p* \< 0.050). The total effect is negative but not significant. (Meaning?) 

Education at wave 1 is positively related to total CAMs used at wave 3 (SEM: *b* = 0.099, 95% CI: 0.027, 0.163, *p* \< 0.010; GSEM: *b* = 0.059, 95% CI: 0.028, 0.090, *p* \< 0.001). Education at wave 1 is negatively related to chronic pain at wave 2 (SEM: *b* = -0.027, 95% CI: -0.045, -0.008, *p* \< 0.010; GSEM: *b* = -0.096, 95% CI: -0.183, -0.009, *p* \< 0.050). Chronic pain at wave 2 is positively related to total CAMs used at wave 3 (GSEM: *b* = 0.070, 95% CI: 0.003, 0.138, *p* \< 0.050). This indicates that individuals with lower education are more likely to experience chronic pain, and those with chronic pain are more likely to utilize CAMs. While the total effect for education on total CAMs via chronic pain is positive and significant (SEM: *b* 0.096, 95% CI: 0.027, 0.163, *p* \< 0.010; GSEM: *b* = 0.052, 95% CI: 0.020, 0.084, *p* \< 0.010), the indirect effect is not significant.

#### High Blood Pressure 

```{r model-totcams-highbp, echo = FALSE, results='hide', fig.show='hide'}
model <- '
# Regressions
# Direct effect - log income 
totalCams_W3 ~ a*LogIncome_W1 
HighBP_W3 ~ b*LogIncome_W1
# Direct Effect - Education
totalCams_W3 ~ c*Education_W1
HighBP_W3 ~ d*Education_W1
# Mediator effects - Income 
HighBP_W2 ~ e*LogIncome_W1 
totalCams_W3 ~ f*HighBP_W2
totalCams_W2 ~ g*LogIncome_W1
HighBP_W3 ~ h*totalCams_W2
# Mediator effects - Education
totalCams_W2 ~ i*Education_W1
HighBP_W2 ~ j*Education_W1 
# Control for previous wave
totalCams_W3 ~ totalCams_W2
HighBP_W3 ~ HighBP_W2
# Indirect effect 
ef := e*f
gh := g*h
jf := j*f
ih := i*h
# total effect
total1 := a + (e*f)
total2 := b + (g*h)
total3 := c + (j*f)
total4 := d + (i*h)
# Controls
totalCams_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + HlthInsurance_W2 + HLSelf_W2 + Spiritual_W2 + Religion_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
HighBP_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
totalCams_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + HlthInsurance_W3 + HLSelf_W3 + Spiritual_W3 + Religion_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
HighBP_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
# Covariances
totalCams_W2 ~~ HighBP_W2
totalCams_W3 ~~ HighBP_W3
'

# Run model and get summary and fit statistics
set.seed(1234)
model.summ <- sem(model, data = path.complete, se = "bootstrap")
summary(model.summ, standardized = TRUE, fit.measures = TRUE)
fitMeasures(model.summ, c("cfi", "rmsea", "srmr"))
#modificationindices(model.summ)

# Create object with model fit measures
fit.totcams.highbp <- lavInspect(model.summ, what = "fit")

# Create object with parameter estimates
est.totcams.highbp <- parameterEstimates(model.summ, boot.ci.type = "bca.simple", standardized = TRUE)


m <- matrix(NA, 4, 3)
m[1, 1] <- "LogIncome_W1"
m[4, 1] <- "Education_W1"
m[2, 2] <- "totalCams_W2"
m[3, 2] <- "HighBP_W2"
m[1, 3] <- "totalCams_W3"
m[4, 3] <- "HighBP_W3"

# Drop controls from path diagram
path_dia <- semptools::drop_nodes(
                object = semPlotModel(model.summ),
                nodes = c("Age_W3", "Sex_W1", "Marital_W3", "HlthInsurance_W3", "HLSelf_W3", "Spiritual_W3", "Religion_W3", "MexicanHispanic_W2", "Black_W2", "OtherRace_W2", "Age_W2", "Marital_W2", "HlthInsurance_W2", "HLSelf_W2", "Spiritual_W2", "Religion_W2"))

# Create path diagram
path_dia2 <- semPaths(path_dia, whatLabels = "std",
           sizeMan = 8,
           edge.label.cex = .8,
           edge.color = "black",
           style = "ram",
           layout = m, 
           exoCov = FALSE,
           nCharNodes = 0, nCharEdges = 0)

# Create list to rearrange positions of node edges that were blocking each other
my_position_list <- c("totalCams_W3 ~ Education_W1" = .20, 
                      "HighBP_W3 ~ LogIncome_W1" = .75)
# Change label position
path_dia3 <- set_edge_label_position(path_dia2, my_position_list)

path_dia4 <- change_node_label(path_dia3,
                           c(LogIncome_W1 = "Income W1",
                             Education_W1 = "Education W1",
                             totalCams_W2 = "Total CAMs W2",
                             HighBP_W2 = "High BP W2", 
                             totalCams_W3 = "Total CAMs W3",
                             HighBP_W3 = "High BP W3"),
                           label.cex = 1.1)

path_dia5 <- mark_sig(path_dia4, model.summ, alpha = c("(n.s.)" = 1.00, "*" = .05))

```

The path diagram depicting the relationships between SES, total CAMs used, and high blood pressure can be seen in Figure \ref{fig:path-totcams-highbp}. Results from the SEM analysis can be found in Tables \ref{tab:de-totcams-highbp}, \ref{tab:ie-totcams-highbp}, and \ref{tab:fit-totcams-highbp}. Results from the GSEM analysis can be found in Tables \ref{tab:de-gsem-totcams-highbp} and \ref{tab:ie-gsem-totcams-highbp}. Model fit indices indicate good model fit (CFI = `r round(fit.totcams.highbp[9], 3)`; TLI = `r round(fit.totcams.highbp[10], 3)`; RMSEA = `r round(fit.totcams.highbp[23],3)`; SRMR = `r round(fit.totcams.highbp[29],3)`; \$\\chi\$^2^(`r round(fit.totcams.highbp[4], 3)`)=`r round(fit.totcams.highbp[3], 3)`, *p* \<.001.).

Income at wave 1 has a negative effect on high blood pressure at wave 2 (SEM: *b* = -0.026, 95% CI: -0.049, -0.002, *p* \< 0.050) but does not have a significant effect on high blood pressure at wave 3. Income also does not have a significant effect on total CAMs used at wave 3. 

Education similarly has a negative effect on high blood pressure at wave 2 (SEM: *b* = -0.024, 95% CI: -0.040, -0.008, *p* \< 0.010; GSEM: *b* = -0.115, 95% CI: -0.210, -0.020, *p* \< 0.050), but not on high blood pressure at wave 3. 

Education is positively related to total CAMs used at wave 3 (SEM: *b* = 0.092, 95% CI: 0.023, 0.156, *p* \< 0.010; GSEM: *b* = 0.056, 95% CI: 0.025, 0.086, *p* \< 0.001). Education at wave 1 is negatively related to high blood pressure at wave 2, as mentioned above. High blood pressure at wave 2 is negatively related to total CAMs used at wave 3 (SEM: *b* = -0.191, 95% CI: -0.354, -0.026, *p* \< 0.050; GSEM: *b* = -0.079, 95% CI: -0.157, 0.000, *p* \< 0.050). This indicates that individuals with higher levels of education are less likely to experience high blood pressure, and individuals with high blood pressure tend to use fewer CAMs. While the total effect of education on total CAMs via high blood pressure is positive and significant (SEM: *b* = 0.096, 95% CI: 0.026, 0.163, *p* \< 0.010; GSEM: *b* = 0.065, 95% CI: 0.032, 0.097, *p* \< 0.001) the indirect effect is not significant.

#### Depression/Anxiety

```{r model-totcams-dep, echo = FALSE, results='hide', fig.show='hide'}
model <- '
# Regressions
# Direct effect - log income 
totalCams_W3 ~ a*LogIncome_W1 
DepAnx_W3 ~ b*LogIncome_W1
# Direct Effect - Education
totalCams_W3 ~ c*Education_W1
DepAnx_W3 ~ d*Education_W1
# Mediator effects - Income 
DepAnx_W2 ~ e*LogIncome_W1 
totalCams_W3 ~ f*DepAnx_W2
totalCams_W2 ~ g*LogIncome_W1
DepAnx_W3 ~ h*totalCams_W2
# Mediator effects - Education
totalCams_W2 ~ i*Education_W1
DepAnx_W2 ~ j*Education_W1 
# Control for previous wave
totalCams_W3 ~ totalCams_W2
DepAnx_W3 ~ DepAnx_W2
# Indirect effect 
ef := e*f
gh := g*h
jf := j*f
ih := i*h
# total effect
total1 := a + (e*f)
total2 := b + (g*h)
total3 := c + (j*f)
total4 := d + (i*h)
# Controls
totalCams_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + HlthInsurance_W2 + HLSelf_W2 + Spiritual_W2 + Religion_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
DepAnx_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
totalCams_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + HlthInsurance_W3 + HLSelf_W3 + Spiritual_W3 + Religion_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
DepAnx_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
# Covariances
totalCams_W2 ~~ DepAnx_W2
totalCams_W3 ~~ DepAnx_W3
'

# Run model and get summary and fit statistics
set.seed(1234)
model.summ <- sem(model, data = path.complete, se = "bootstrap")
summary(model.summ, standardized = TRUE, fit.measures = TRUE)
fitMeasures(model.summ, c("cfi", "rmsea", "srmr"))
#modificationindices(model.summ)

# Create object with model fit measures
fit.totcams.dep <- lavInspect(model.summ, what = "fit")

# Create object with parameter estimates
est.totcams.dep <- parameterEstimates(model.summ, boot.ci.type = "bca.simple", standardized = TRUE)


m <- matrix(NA, 4, 3)
m[1, 1] <- "LogIncome_W1"
m[4, 1] <- "Education_W1"
m[2, 2] <- "totalCams_W2"
m[3, 2] <- "DepAnx_W2"
m[1, 3] <- "totalCams_W3"
m[4, 3] <- "DepAnx_W3"

# Drop controls from path diagram
path_dia <- semptools::drop_nodes(
                object = semPlotModel(model.summ),
                nodes = c("Age_W3", "Sex_W1", "Marital_W3", "HlthInsurance_W3", "HLSelf_W3", "Spiritual_W3", "Religion_W3", "MexicanHispanic_W2", "Black_W2", "OtherRace_W2", "Age_W2", "Marital_W2", "HlthInsurance_W2", "HLSelf_W2", "Spiritual_W2", "Religion_W2"))

# Create path diagram
path_dia2 <- semPaths(path_dia, whatLabels = "std",
           sizeMan = 8,
           edge.label.cex = .8,
           edge.color = "black",
           style = "ram",
           layout = m, 
           exoCov = FALSE,
           nCharNodes = 0, nCharEdges = 0)

# Create list to rearrange positions of node edges that were blocking each other
my_position_list <- c("totalCams_W3 ~ Education_W1" = .20, 
                      "DepAnx_W3 ~ LogIncome_W1" = .75)
# Change label position
path_dia3 <- set_edge_label_position(path_dia2, my_position_list)

path_dia4 <- change_node_label(path_dia3,
                           c(LogIncome_W1 = "Income W1",
                             Education_W1 = "Education W1",
                             totalCams_W2 = "Total CAMs W2",
                             DepAnx_W2 = "DepAnx W2", 
                             totalCams_W3 = "Total CAMs W3",
                             DepAnx_W3 = "DepAnx W3"),
                           label.cex = 1.1)

path_dia5 <- mark_sig(path_dia4, model.summ, alpha = c("(n.s.)" = 1.00, "*" = .05))

```

The path diagram representing relationships between SES, total CAMs used, and depression/anxiety can be seen in Figure \ref{fig:path-totcams-dep}. Results from the SEM analysis can be found in Tables \ref{tab:de-totcams-dep}, \ref{tab:ie-totcams-dep}, and \ref{tab:fit-totcams-dep}. Results from the GSEM analysis can be found in Tables \ref{tab:de-gsem-totcams-depression} and \ref{tab:ie-gsem-totcams-depression}. Model fit indices indicate overall good model fit (CFI = `r round(fit.totcams.dep[9], 3)`; TLI = `r round(fit.totcams.dep[10], 3)`; RMSEA = `r round(fit.totcams.dep[23],3)`; SRMR = `r round(fit.totcams.dep[29],3)`; \$\\chi\$^2^(`r round(fit.totcams.dep[4], 3)`)=`r round(fit.totcams.dep[3], 3)`, *p* \<.001.).

Income at wave 1 has a significant negative effect on depression/anxiety at wave 2 (SEM: *b* = -0.024, 95% CI: -0.047, -0.003, *p* \< 0.050; GSEM: *b* -0.148, 95% CI: -0.292, -0.005, *p* \< 0.050); however, results from the SEM and GSEM analyses show no effect for income on depression/anxiety at wave 3. Results also show no effect for income at wave 1 on total CAMs used at waves 2 or 3. 

Education at wave 1 is negatively associated with depression and anxiety at wave 3 (SEM: *b* = -0.018, 95% CI: -0.034, -0.004, *p* \< 0.050; GSEM: *b* = -0.123, 95% CI: -0.237, -0.009, *p* \< 0.050). Education at wave 1 is positively related to total CAMs used at wave 2 (SEM: *b* = 0.275, 95% CI: 0.197, 0.350, *p* \< 0.001; GSEM: *b* = 0.139, 95% CI: 0.110, 0.168, *p* \< 0.001). Total CAMs used at wave 2 has a positive effect on depression/anxiety at wave 3 (SEM: *b* = 0.009, 95% CI: 0.001, 0.017, *p* \< 0.050; GSEM: *b* = 0.065, 95% CI: 0.008, 0.123, *p* \< 0.050). This indicates that individuals with lower levels of education report using fewer total CAMs, and that individuals who use more CAMs are more likely to report experiencing depression and anxiety. GSEM results show a significant positive indirect effect for the effect of education on depression and anxiety mediated by total CAMs used (*b* = 0.009, 95% CI: 0.009, 0.017, *p* \< 0.050) and a negative total effect (*b* = -0.114, 95% CI: -0.227, -0.001, *p* \< 0.050). 

Results do not provide evidence that depression and anxiety mediate the relationship between education and total CAMs used. While education has a positive direct effect on total CAMs used at wave 3 (SEM: *b* = 0.096, 95% CI: 0.027, 0.162, *p* \< 0.010; GSEM: *b* = 0.057, 95% CI: 0.026, 0.088, *p* \< 0.001), education at wave 1 does not have a significant effect on depression and anxiety at wave 2.

### Mind-Body Medicines 

In the following section I will present results from models testing whether use of mind-body medicines mediates the relationship between SES and several health outcomes (sum of chronic conditions, self-reported health, chronic pain, and depression/anxiety). Models also test whether health condition mediates the relationship between SES and use of mind-body medicine. 

#### Chronic Conditions 

```{r model-mb-chron, echo = FALSE, results='hide', fig.show='hide'}
model <- '
# Regressions
# Direct effect - log income 
mindbody_W3 ~ a*LogIncome_W1 
SumChron_W3 ~ b*LogIncome_W1
# Direct Effect - Education
mindbody_W3 ~ c*Education_W1
SumChron_W3 ~ d*Education_W1
# Mediator effects - Income 
SumChron_W2 ~ e*LogIncome_W1 
mindbody_W3 ~ f*SumChron_W2
mindbody_W2 ~ g*LogIncome_W1
SumChron_W3 ~ h*mindbody_W2
# Mediator effects - Education
mindbody_W2 ~ i*Education_W1
SumChron_W2 ~ j*Education_W1 
# Control for previous wave
mindbody_W3 ~ mindbody_W2
SumChron_W3 ~ SumChron_W2
# Indirect effect 
ef := e*f
gh := g*h
jf := j*f
ih := i*h
# total effect
total1 := a + (e*f)
total2 := b + (g*h)
total3 := c + (j*f)
total4 := d + (i*h)
# Controls
mindbody_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + HlthInsurance_W2 + HLSelf_W2 + Spiritual_W2 + Religion_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
SumChron_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
mindbody_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + HlthInsurance_W3 + HLSelf_W3 + Spiritual_W3 + Religion_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
SumChron_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
# Covariances
mindbody_W2 ~~ SumChron_W2
mindbody_W3 ~~ SumChron_W3
'


# Run model and get summary and fit statistics
set.seed(1234)
model.summ <- sem(model, data = path.complete, se = "bootstrap")
summary(model.summ, standardized = TRUE)
fitMeasures(model.summ, c("cfi", "rmsea", "srmr"))
#modificationindices(model.summ)

# Create object with model fit measures
fit.mb.chron <- lavInspect(model.summ, what = "fit")

# Create object with parameter estimates
est.mb.chron <- parameterEstimates(model.summ, boot.ci.type = "bca.simple", standardized = TRUE)


m <- matrix(NA, 4, 3)
m[1, 1] <- "LogIncome_W1"
m[4, 1] <- "Education_W1"
m[2, 2] <- "mindbody_W2"
m[3, 2] <- "SumChron_W2"
m[1, 3] <- "mindbody_W3"
m[4, 3] <- "SumChron_W3"

# Drop controls from path diagram
path_dia <- semptools::drop_nodes(
                object = semPlotModel(model.summ),
                nodes = c("Age_W3", "Sex_W1", "Marital_W3", "HlthInsurance_W3", "HLSelf_W3", "Spiritual_W3", "Religion_W3", "MexicanHispanic_W2", "Black_W2", "OtherRace_W2", "Age_W2", "Marital_W2", "HlthInsurance_W2", "HLSelf_W2", "Spiritual_W2", "Religion_W2"))

# Create path diagram
path_dia2 <- semPaths(path_dia, whatLabels = "std",
           sizeMan = 8,
           edge.label.cex = .8,
           edge.color = "black",
           style = "ram",
           layout = m, 
           exoCov = FALSE,
           nCharNodes = 0, nCharEdges = 0)

# Create list to rearrange positions of node edges that were blocking each other
my_position_list <- c("mindbody_W3 ~ Education_W1" = .20, 
                      "SumChron_W3 ~ LogIncome_W1" = .75)
# Change label position
path_dia3 <- set_edge_label_position(path_dia2, my_position_list)

path_dia4 <- change_node_label(path_dia3,
                           c(LogIncome_W1 = "Income W1",
                             Education_W1 = "Education W1",
                             mindbody_W2 = "Mind Body W2",
                             SumChron_W2 = "Sum Chron W2", 
                             mindbody_W3 = "Mind Body W3",
                             SumChron_W3 = "Sum Chron W3"),
                           label.cex = 1.1)

path_dia5 <- mark_sig(path_dia4, model.summ, alpha = c("(n.s.)" = 1.00, "*" = .05))

```

The model testing the relationships between SES, use of mind-body medicines, and health can be seen in Figure \ref{fig:path-mb-chron}. Results from the SEM analysis can be found in Tables \ref{tab:de-mb-chron}, \ref{tab:ie-mb-chron}, and \ref{tab:fit-mb-chron}. Results from the GSEM analysis can be found in Tables \ref{tab:de-gsem-mindbody-chron} and \ref{tab:ie-gsem-mindbody-chron}. Most goodness of fit indices indicate good model fit (\$\\chi\$^2^(`r round(fit.mb.chron[4],3)`) = `r round(fit.mb.chron[3],3)`, *p* \< 0.001; CFI = `r round(fit.mb.chron[9], 3)`; TLI = `r round(fit.mb.chron[10],3)`; RMSEA = `r round(fit.mb.chron[23],3)`, SRMR = `r round(fit.mb.chron[29],3)`). 

Results do not provide evidence for mind-body medicine use as a mediator of the relationship between income and health, or for health as a mediator for the relationship between income and mind-body medicine use. GSEM results show that income at wave 1 has a significant negative direct effect on sum of chronic conditions at wave 3 (GSEM: *b* = -0.060, 95% CI: -0.089, -0.032, *p* \< 0.001); however, income at wave 1 is not significantly related to use of mind-body medicines at wave 2. Logged income at wave 1 does not have a significant direct effect on mind-body medicine use at wave 3. 

Results do not provide evidence for mind-body medicine as a mediator of the relationship between education and sum of chronic conditions. Education has a negative direct effect on sum of chronic conditions at wave 3 (SEM: *b* = `r round(est.mb.chron$est[4], 3)`, 95% CI: `r round(est.mb.chron$ci.lower[4],3)`, `r round(est.mb.chron$ci.upper[4],3)`, *p* \< 0.01; GSEM: *b* -0.034, 95% CI: -0.058, -0.011, *p* \< 0.010) and a significant positive relationship with use of mind-body medicines at wave 2 (SEM: *b* = 0.069, 95% CI: 0.051, 0.085, *p* \< 0.001; GSEM: *b* = 0.340, 95% CI: 0.247, 0.432, *p* \< 0.001). However, mind-body medicine is not significantly related to sum of chronic conditions.  

Education at wave 1 has a positive direct effect on use of mind-body medicines at wave 3 (*b* = `r round(est.mb.chron$est[3],3)`, 95% CI: `r round(est.mb.chron$ci.lower[3],3)`, `r round(est.mb.chron$ci.upper[3],3)`, *p* \< 0.001; GSEM: *b* = 0.230, 95% CI: 0.128, 0.332, *p* \< 0.001) but this relationship is not mediated by sum of chronic conditions at wave 2. While education at wave 1 has a significant negative effect on sum of chronic conditions at wave 2 (SEM: *b* = -0.161, 95% CI: -0.264, -0.057, *p* \< 0.010; GSEM: *b* = -0.046, 95% CI: -0.073, -0.019, *p* \< 0.001), sum of chronic conditions at wave 2 does not predict use of mind-body medicines at wave 3.

```{r model-mb-srh, echo = FALSE, results='hide', fig.show='hide'}
model <- '
# Regressions
# Direct effect - log income 
mindbody_W3 ~ a*LogIncome_W1 
SRH_W3 ~ b*LogIncome_W1
# Direct Effect - Education
mindbody_W3 ~ c*Education_W1
SRH_W3 ~ d*Education_W1
# Mediator effects - Income 
SRH_W2 ~ e*LogIncome_W1 
mindbody_W3 ~ f*SRH_W2
mindbody_W2 ~ g*LogIncome_W1
SRH_W3 ~ h*mindbody_W2
# Mediator effects - Education
mindbody_W2 ~ i*Education_W1
SRH_W2 ~ j*Education_W1 
# Control for previous wave
mindbody_W3 ~ mindbody_W2
SRH_W3 ~ SRH_W2
# Indirect effect 
ef := e*f
gh := g*h
jf := j*f
ih := i*h
# total effect
total1 := a + (e*f)
total2 := b + (g*h)
total3 := c + (j*f)
total4 := d + (i*h)
# Controls
mindbody_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + HlthInsurance_W2 + HLSelf_W2 + Spiritual_W2 + Religion_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
SRH_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
mindbody_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + HlthInsurance_W3 + HLSelf_W3 + Spiritual_W3 + Religion_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
SRH_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
# Covariances
mindbody_W2 ~~ SRH_W2
mindbody_W3 ~~ SRH_W3
'


# Run model and get summary and fit statistics
set.seed(1234)
model.summ <- sem(model, data = path.complete, se = "bootstrap")
summary(model.summ, standardized = TRUE)
fitMeasures(model.summ, c("cfi", "rmsea", "srmr"))
#modificationindices(model.summ)

# Create object with model fit measures
fit.mb.SRH <- lavInspect(model.summ, what = "fit")

# Create object with parameter estimates
est.mb.SRH <- parameterEstimates(model.summ, boot.ci.type = "bca.simple", standardized = TRUE)



m <- matrix(NA, 4, 3)
m[1, 1] <- "LogIncome_W1"
m[4, 1] <- "Education_W1"
m[2, 2] <- "mindbody_W2"
m[3, 2] <- "SRH_W2"
m[1, 3] <- "mindbody_W3"
m[4, 3] <- "SRH_W3"

# Drop controls from path diagram
path_dia <- semptools::drop_nodes(
                object = semPlotModel(model.summ),
                nodes = c("Age_W3", "Sex_W1", "Marital_W3", "HlthInsurance_W3", "HLSelf_W3", "Spiritual_W3", "Religion_W3", "MexicanHispanic_W2", "Black_W2", "OtherRace_W2", "Age_W2", "Marital_W2", "HlthInsurance_W2", "HLSelf_W2", "Spiritual_W2", "Religion_W2"))

# Create path diagram
path_dia2 <- semPaths(path_dia, whatLabels = "std",
           sizeMan = 8,
           edge.label.cex = .8,
           edge.color = "black",
           style = "ram",
           layout = m, 
           exoCov = FALSE,
           nCharNodes = 0, nCharEdges = 0)

# Create list to rearrange positions of node edges that were blocking each other
my_position_list <- c("mindbody_W3 ~ Education_W1" = .20, 
                      "SRH_W3 ~ LogIncome_W1" = .75)
# Change label position
path_dia3 <- set_edge_label_position(path_dia2, my_position_list)

path_dia4 <- change_node_label(path_dia3,
                           c(LogIncome_W1 = "Income W1",
                             Education_W1 = "Education W1",
                             mindbody_W2 = "Mind Body W2",
                             SRH_W2 = "SRH W2", 
                             mindbody_W3 = "Mind Body W3",
                             SRH_W3 = "SRH W3"),
                           label.cex = 1.1)

path_dia5 <- mark_sig(path_dia4, model.summ, alpha = c("(n.s.)" = 1.00, "*" = .05))





```

Next the relationships between SES, use of mind-body medicines, and self-reported health were examined. The path diagram can be seen in Figure \ref{fig:path-mb-srh}. Results from the SEM analysis can be found in Tables \ref{tab:de-mb-srh}, \ref{tab:ie-mb-srh}, and \ref{tab:fit-mb-srh}. Results from the GSEM analysis can be found in Tables \ref{tab:de-gsem-mb-srh} and \ref{tab:ie-gsem-mb-srh}. Goodness of fit indices indicate poor model fit (\$\\chi\$^2^(`r round(fit.mb.SRH[4],3)`) = `r round(fit.mb.SRH[3],3)`, *p* \< 0.001; CFI = `r round(fit.mb.SRH[9], 3)`; TLI = `r round(fit.mb.SRH[10],3)`; RMSEA = `r round(fit.mb.SRH[23],3)`, SRMR = `r round(fit.mb.SRH[29],3)`. 

SEM and GSEM analyses do not provide evidence for mind-body medicine and self-reported health as mediators. Logged income at wave 1 has a positive direct effect on SRH at wave 3 (*b* = `r round(est.mb.SRH$est[2], 3)`, 95% CI: `r round(est.mb.SRH$ci.lower[2],3)`, `r round(est.mb.SRH$ci.upper[2],3)`, *p* \< 0.001; GSEM: *b* = 0.070, 95% CI: 0.025, 0.115, *p* \< 0.010) but this effect is not mediated by use of mind-body medicine at wave 2. Logged income at wave 1 does not have a direct effect on use of mind-body medicines at wave 3. 

Education has a positive direct effect on SRH at wave 3 (*b* = `r round(est.mb.SRH$est[4], 3)`, 95% CI: `r round(est.mb.SRH$ci.lower[4],3)`, `r round(est.mb.SRH$ci.upper[4],3)`, *p* \< 0.001; GSEM: *b* = 0.070, 95% CI: 0.025, 0.115, *p* \< 0.010), but the relationship is not mediated by use of mind-body medicines at wave 2.  While education has a positive direct effect on mind-body medicine use at wave 2 (SEM: *b* 0.069, 95% CI: 0.051, 0.085, *p* \< 0.001; GSEM: *b* = 0.340, 95% CI: 0.247, 0.432, *p* \< 0.001), mind-body medicine does not significantly predict sum of chronic conditions. 

Education has a positive direct effect on use of mind-body medicines at wave 3 (*b* = `r round(est.mb.chron$est[3],3)`, 95% CI: `r round(est.mb.chron$ci.lower[3],3)`, `r round(est.mb.chron$ci.upper[3],3)`, *p* \< 0.01; GSEM: *b* = 0.235, 95% CI: 0.131, 0.339, *p* \< 0.001) but the relationship is not mediated by SRH at wave 2. While education has a positive direct effect on SRH at wave 2 (SEM: *b* = 0.163, 95% CI: 0.126, 0.200, *p* \< 0.001; GSEM: *b* = 0.177, 95% CI: 0.133, 0.220, *p* \< 0.001), SRH at wave 2 does not significantly predict use of mind-body medicines at wave 3.

```{r model-mb-chronicpain, echo = FALSE, results='hide', fig.show='hide'}
model <- '
# Regressions
# Direct effect - log income 
mindbody_W3 ~ a*LogIncome_W1 
ChronicPain_W3 ~ b*LogIncome_W1
# Direct Effect - Education
mindbody_W3 ~ c*Education_W1
ChronicPain_W3 ~ d*Education_W1
# Mediator effects - Income 
ChronicPain_W2 ~ e*LogIncome_W1 
mindbody_W3 ~ f*ChronicPain_W2
mindbody_W2 ~ g*LogIncome_W1
ChronicPain_W3 ~ h*mindbody_W2
# Mediator effects - Education
mindbody_W2 ~ i*Education_W1
ChronicPain_W2 ~ j*Education_W1 
# Control for previous wave
mindbody_W3 ~ mindbody_W2
ChronicPain_W3 ~ ChronicPain_W2
# Indirect effect 
ef := e*f
gh := g*h
jf := j*f
ih := i*h
# total effect
total1 := a + (e*f)
total2 := b + (g*h)
total3 := c + (j*f)
total4 := d + (i*h)
# Controls
mindbody_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + HlthInsurance_W2 + HLSelf_W2 + Spiritual_W2 + Religion_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
ChronicPain_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
mindbody_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + HlthInsurance_W3 + HLSelf_W3 + Spiritual_W3 + Religion_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
ChronicPain_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
# Covariances
mindbody_W2 ~~ ChronicPain_W2
mindbody_W3 ~~ ChronicPain_W3
'

# Run model and get summary and fit statistics
set.seed(1234)
model.summ <- sem(model, data = path.complete, se = "bootstrap")
summary(model.summ, standardized = TRUE, fit.measures = TRUE)
fitMeasures(model.summ, c("cfi", "rmsea", "srmr"))
#modificationindices(model.summ)

# Create object with model fit measures
fit.mb.chronicpain <- lavInspect(model.summ, what = "fit")

# Create object with parameter estimates
est.mb.chronicpain <- parameterEstimates(model.summ, boot.ci.type = "bca.simple", standardized = TRUE)


m <- matrix(NA, 4, 3)
m[1, 1] <- "LogIncome_W1"
m[4, 1] <- "Education_W1"
m[2, 2] <- "mindbody_W2"
m[3, 2] <- "ChronicPain_W2"
m[1, 3] <- "mindbody_W3"
m[4, 3] <- "ChronicPain_W3"

# Drop controls from path diagram
path_dia <- semptools::drop_nodes(
                object = semPlotModel(model.summ),
                nodes = c("Age_W3", "Sex_W1", "Marital_W3", "HlthInsurance_W3", "HLSelf_W3", "Spiritual_W3", "Religion_W3", "MexicanHispanic_W2", "Black_W2", "OtherRace_W2", "Age_W2", "Marital_W2", "HlthInsurance_W2", "HLSelf_W2", "Spiritual_W2", "Religion_W2"))

# Create path diagram
path_dia2 <- semPaths(path_dia, whatLabels = "std",
           sizeMan = 8,
           edge.label.cex = .8,
           edge.color = "black",
           style = "ram",
           layout = m, 
           exoCov = FALSE,
           nCharNodes = 0, nCharEdges = 0)

# Create list to rearrange positions of node edges that were blocking each other
my_position_list <- c("mindbody_W3 ~ Education_W1" = .20, 
                      "ChronicPain_W3 ~ LogIncome_W1" = .75)
# Change label position
path_dia3 <- set_edge_label_position(path_dia2, my_position_list)

path_dia4 <- change_node_label(path_dia3,
                           c(LogIncome_W1 = "Income W1",
                             Education_W1 = "Education W1",
                             mindbody_W2 = "Mind-Body Medicines W2",
                             ChronicPain_W2 = "Chronic Pain W2", 
                             mindbody_W3 = "Mind-Body Medicines W3",
                             ChronicPain_W3 = "Chronic Pain W3"),
                           label.cex = 1.1)

path_dia5 <- mark_sig(path_dia4, model.summ, alpha = c("(n.s.)" = 1.00, "*" = .05))

```

The path diagram depicting the relationships tested between SES, mind-body medicines, and chronic pain can be found in Figure \ref{fig:path-mb-chronicpain}. Results from the SEM analysis can be found in Tables \ref{tab:de-mb-chronicpain}, \ref{tab:ie-mb-chronicpain}, and \ref{tab:fit-mb-chronicpain}. Results from the GSEM analysis can be found in Tables \ref{tab:de-gsem-mb-chronicpain} and \ref{tab:ie-gsem-mb-chronicpain}. Goodness of fit indices indicate good model fit (\$\\chi\$^2^(`r round(fit.mb.chronicpain[4],3)`) = `r round(fit.mb.chronicpain[3],3)`, *p* \< 0.001; CFI = `r round(fit.mb.chronicpain[9], 3)`; TLI = `r round(fit.mb.chronicpain[10],3)`; RMSEA = `r round(fit.mb.chronicpain[23],3)`, SRMR = `r round(fit.mb.chronicpain[29],3)`.

Results do not support *Hypotheses 1a and 4a* given the lack of association between income and use of mind-body medicines. Results from SEM analyses show some support for *Hypothesis 2a*. Income at wave 1 is negatively associated with chronic pain at wave 2 (SEM: *b* = -0.032, 95% CI: -0.058, -0.005, *p* \< 0.050), but is not related to chronic pain at wave 3. *Hypothesis 3a* is thus not supported, given the lack of association between income and the health outcome chronic pain.

Results show support for *Hypothesis 1b*. Education at wave 1 is positively associated with use of mind-body medicine at wave 3 (SEM: *b* = 0.039, 95% CI: 0.023, 0.056, *p* \< 0.001;  GSEM: *b* = 0.228, 95% CI: 0.126, 0.330, *p* \< 0.001). Results do not show support for *Hypothesis 4b*. Education is negatively related to chronic pain at wave 2 (SEM: *b* = -0.027, 95% CI: -0.045, -0.008, *p* \< 0.010; GSEM: *b* = -0.096, 95% CI: -0.183, -0.009, *p* \< 0.050). Chronic pain, however, does not predict use of mind-body medicines at wave 3. 

Results from SEM analyses show support for *Hypothesis 2b*. Education at wave 1 is negatively related to chronic pain at wave 3 (SEM: *b* = -0.021, 95% CI: -0.039, -0.001, *p* \< 0.050). GSEM analyses show a significant negative relationship between education at wave 1 and chronic pain at wave 2 (*b* = -0.096, 95% CI: -0.183, -0.009, *p* \< 0.050) but not chronic pain at wave 3. 

Results from SEM and GSEM analyses do not show support for *Hypothesis 3b*. While education is positively associated with use of mind-body medicines at wave 2 (SEM: *b* = 0.069, 95% CI: 0.052, 0.086, *p* \< 0.001; GSEM: *b* = 0.341, 95% CI: 0.247, 0.432, *p* \< 0.001), mind-body medicine does not significantly predict chronic pain at wave 3. Thus mind-body medicine is not a mediator for the relationship between education and chronic pain.

#### Depression and Anxiety

```{r model-mb-dep, echo = FALSE, results='hide', fig.show='hide'}
model <- '
# Regressions
# Direct effect - log income 
mindbody_W3 ~ a*LogIncome_W1 
DepAnx_W3 ~ b*LogIncome_W1
# Direct Effect - Education
mindbody_W3 ~ c*Education_W1
DepAnx_W3 ~ d*Education_W1
# Mediator effects - Income 
DepAnx_W2 ~ e*LogIncome_W1 
mindbody_W3 ~ f*DepAnx_W2
mindbody_W2 ~ g*LogIncome_W1
DepAnx_W3 ~ h*mindbody_W2
# Mediator effects - Education
mindbody_W2 ~ i*Education_W1
DepAnx_W2 ~ j*Education_W1 
# Control for previous wave
mindbody_W3 ~ mindbody_W2
DepAnx_W3 ~ DepAnx_W2
# Indirect effect 
ef := e*f
gh := g*h
jf := j*f
ih := i*h
# total effect
total1 := a + (e*f)
total2 := b + (g*h)
total3 := c + (j*f)
total4 := d + (i*h)
# Controls
mindbody_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + HlthInsurance_W2 + HLSelf_W2 + Spiritual_W2 + Religion_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
DepAnx_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
mindbody_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + HlthInsurance_W3 + HLSelf_W3 + Spiritual_W3 + Religion_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
DepAnx_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
# Covariances
mindbody_W2 ~~ DepAnx_W2
mindbody_W3 ~~ DepAnx_W3
'

# Run model and get summary and fit statistics
set.seed(1234)
model.summ <- sem(model, data = path.complete, se = "bootstrap")
summary(model.summ, standardized = TRUE, fit.measures = TRUE)
fitMeasures(model.summ, c("cfi", "rmsea", "srmr"))
#modificationindices(model.summ)

# Create object with model fit measures
fit.mb.dep <- lavInspect(model.summ, what = "fit")

# Create object with parameter estimates
est.mb.dep <- parameterEstimates(model.summ, boot.ci.type = "bca.simple", standardized = TRUE)


m <- matrix(NA, 4, 3)
m[1, 1] <- "LogIncome_W1"
m[4, 1] <- "Education_W1"
m[2, 2] <- "mindbody_W2"
m[3, 2] <- "DepAnx_W2"
m[1, 3] <- "mindbody_W3"
m[4, 3] <- "DepAnx_W3"

# Drop controls from path diagram
path_dia <- semptools::drop_nodes(
                object = semPlotModel(model.summ),
                nodes = c("Age_W3", "Sex_W1", "Marital_W3", "HlthInsurance_W3", "HLSelf_W3", "Spiritual_W3", "Religion_W3", "MexicanHispanic_W2", "Black_W2", "OtherRace_W2", "Age_W2", "Marital_W2", "HlthInsurance_W2", "HLSelf_W2", "Spiritual_W2", "Religion_W2"))

# Create path diagram
path_dia2 <- semPaths(path_dia, whatLabels = "std",
           sizeMan = 8,
           edge.label.cex = .8,
           edge.color = "black",
           style = "ram",
           layout = m, 
           exoCov = FALSE,
           nCharNodes = 0, nCharEdges = 0)

# Create list to rearrange positions of node edges that were blocking each other
my_position_list <- c("mindbody_W3 ~ Education_W1" = .20, 
                      "DepAnx_W3 ~ LogIncome_W1" = .75)
# Change label position
path_dia3 <- set_edge_label_position(path_dia2, my_position_list)

path_dia4 <- change_node_label(path_dia3,
                           c(LogIncome_W1 = "Income W1",
                             Education_W1 = "Education W1",
                             mindbody_W2 = "Mind-Body Medicines W2",
                             DepAnx_W2 = "DepAnx W2", 
                             mindbody_W3 = "Mind-Body Medicines W3",
                             DepAnx_W3 = "DepAnx W3"),
                           label.cex = 1.1)

path_dia5 <- mark_sig(path_dia4, model.summ, alpha = c("(n.s.)" = 1.00, "*" = .05))
```

The path diagram depicting the structural model testing the relationships between SES, use of mind-body medicines, and depression/anxiety can be seen in Figure \ref{fig:path-mb-dep}. Results from the SEM analysis can be found in Tables \ref{tab:de-mb-dep}, \ref{tab:ie-mb-dep}, and \ref{tab:fit-mb-dep}. Results from the GSEM analysis can be found in Tables \ref{tab:de-gsem-mb-depression} and \ref{tab:ie-gsem-mb-depression}. Goodness of fit indices indicate good model fit (\$\\chi\$^2^(`r round(fit.mb.dep[4],3)`) = `r round(fit.mb.dep[3],3)`, *p* \< 0.001; CFI = `r round(fit.mb.dep[9], 3)`; TLI = `r round(fit.mb.dep[10],3)`; RMSEA = `r round(fit.mb.dep[23],3)`, SRMR = `r round(fit.mb.dep[29],3)`.

Results do not provide support for *Hypothesis 1a*. Income does not predict use of mind-body medicines. Results do show some support for *Hypothesis 2a*. Income at wave 1 is negatively associated with depression/anxiety at wave 2 (SEM: *b* = -0.024, 95% CI: -0.047, -0.003, *p* \< 0.050; GSEM: *b* = -0.148, 95% CI: -0.292, -0.005, *p* \< 0.050), but not depression/anxiety at wave 3. Results do not show support for *Hypothesis 3a* given that income at wave 1 is not associated with use of mind-body medicines at wave 2 or depression/anxiety at wave 3. Results do not show support for *Hypothesis 4a* given that income is not associated with use of mind-body medicines at wave 3. 

Results provide support for *Hypothesis 1b*. Education at wave 1 is positively related to use of mind-body medicines at wave 3 (SEM: *b* = 0.039, 95% CI: 0.022, 0.056, *p* \< 0.001; GSEM: *b* = 0.227, 95% CI: 0.125, 0.329, *p* \< 0.001). Results also show support for *Hypothesis 2b*. Education at wave 2 has a significant negative effect on depression/anxiety at wave 3 (SEM: *b* = -0.018, 95% CI: -0.034, -0.003, *p* \< 0.050; GSEM: *b* = -0.115, 95% CI: -0.229, -0.002, *p* \< 0.050). Results do not show support for *Hypothesis 3b*. While education at wave 1 is negatively related to depression/anxiety at wave 3, and education at wave 1 is positively associated with use of mind-body medicines at wave 2 (SEM: *b* = 0.069, 95% CI: 0.051, 0.085, *p* \< 0.001; GSEM: *b* = 0.340, 95% CI: 0.247, 0.432, *p* \< 0.001), use of mind-body medicines at wave 2 is not significantly associated with depression/anxiety at wave 3. Similarly, results do not show support for *Hypothesis 4b*. Education at wave 1 is not significantly related to depression/anxiety at wave 2, and depression/anxiety at wave 2 is not significantly related to use of mind-body medicines at wave 3.

### Alternative Medical Systems

In the following section I review results from path analyses testing simultaneously testing whether use of alternative medical systems mediates the relationship between SES and several health outcomes (sum of chronic conditions, SRH, high blood pressure, diabetes, chronic pain, depression) and whether health condition mediates the relationship between SES and use of alternative medical systems. 

#### Chronic Conditions


```{r model-altmed-chron, echo = FALSE, results='hide', fig.show='hide'}
model <- '
# Regressions
# Direct effect - log income 
altmed_W3 ~ a*LogIncome_W1 
SumChron_W3 ~ b*LogIncome_W1
# Direct Effect - Education
altmed_W3 ~ c*Education_W1
SumChron_W3 ~ d*Education_W1
# Mediator effects - Income 
SumChron_W2 ~ e*LogIncome_W1 
altmed_W3 ~ f*SumChron_W2
altmed_W2 ~ g*LogIncome_W1
SumChron_W3 ~ h*altmed_W2
# Mediator effects - Education
altmed_W2 ~ i*Education_W1
SumChron_W2 ~ j*Education_W1 
# Control for previous wave
altmed_W3 ~ altmed_W2
SumChron_W3 ~ SumChron_W2
# Indirect effect 
ef := e*f
gh := g*h
jf := j*f
ih := i*h
# total effect
total1 := a + (e*f)
total2 := b + (g*h)
total3 := c + (j*f)
total4 := d + (i*h)
# Controls
altmed_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + HlthInsurance_W2 + HLSelf_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
SumChron_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
altmed_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + HlthInsurance_W3 + HLSelf_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
SumChron_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
# Covariances
altmed_W2 ~~ SumChron_W2
altmed_W3 ~~ SumChron_W3
'


# Run model and get summary and fit statistics
set.seed(1234)
model.summ <- sem(model, data = path.complete, se = "bootstrap")
summary(model.summ, standardized = TRUE)
fitMeasures(model.summ, c("cfi", "rmsea", "srmr"))
#modificationindices(model.summ)

# Create object with model fit measures
fit.altmed.chron <- lavInspect(model.summ, what = "fit")

# Create object with parameter estimates
est.altmed.chron <- parameterEstimates(model.summ, boot.ci.type = "bca.simple", standardized = TRUE)


m <- matrix(NA, 4, 3)
m[1, 1] <- "LogIncome_W1"
m[4, 1] <- "Education_W1"
m[2, 2] <- "altmed_W2"
m[3, 2] <- "SumChron_W2"
m[1, 3] <- "altmed_W3"
m[4, 3] <- "SumChron_W3"

# Drop controls from path diagram
path_dia <- semptools::drop_nodes(
                object = semPlotModel(model.summ),
                nodes = c("Age_W3", "Sex_W1", "Marital_W3", "HlthInsurance_W3", "HLSelf_W3", "Spiritual_W3", "Religion_W3", "MexicanHispanic_W2", "Black_W2", "OtherRace_W2", "Age_W2", "Marital_W2", "HlthInsurance_W2", "HLSelf_W2", "Spiritual_W2", "Religion_W2"))

# Create path diagram
path_dia2 <- semPaths(path_dia, whatLabels = "std",
           sizeMan = 8,
           edge.label.cex = .8,
           edge.color = "black",
           style = "ram",
           layout = m, 
           exoCov = FALSE,
           nCharNodes = 0, nCharEdges = 0)

# Create list to rearrange positions of node edges that were blocking each other
my_position_list <- c("altmed_W3 ~ Education_W1" = .20, 
                      "SumChron_W3 ~ LogIncome_W1" = .75)
# Change label position
path_dia3 <- set_edge_label_position(path_dia2, my_position_list)

path_dia4 <- change_node_label(path_dia3,
                           c(LogIncome_W1 = "Income W1",
                             Education_W1 = "Education W1",
                             altmed_W2 = "Alt Med W2",
                             SumChron_W2 = "Sum Chron W2", 
                             altmed_W3 = "Alt Med W3",
                             SumChron_W3 = "Sum Chron W3"),
                           label.cex = 1.1)

path_dia5 <- mark_sig(path_dia4, model.summ, alpha = c("(n.s.)" = 1.00, "*" = .05))





```

The path diagram depicting the model testing relationships between SES, use of alternative medical systems, and health can be seen in Figure \ref{fig:path-altmed-chron}. Results from the SEM analysis can be found in Tables \ref{tab:de-altmed-chron}, \ref{tab:ie-altmed-chron}, and \ref{tab:fit-altmed-chron}. Results from the GSEM analysis can be found in Tables \ref{tab:de-gsem-altmed-chron} and \ref{tab:ie-gsem-altmed-chron}. Most goodness of fit indices indicate good model fit (\$\\chi\$^2^(`r round(fit.altmed.chron[4],3)`) = `r round(fit.altmed.chron[3],3)`, *p* \< 0.001; CFI = `r round(fit.altmed.chron[9], 3)`; TLI = `r round(fit.altmed.chron[10],3)`; RMSEA = `r round(fit.altmed.chron[23],3)`, SRMR = `r round(fit.altmed.chron[29],3)`).

Results do not support *Hypothesis 1a*. Income is not significantly related to use of alternative medical systems. Results show some support for *Hypothesis 2a*. Income at wave 1 is negatively related to sum of chronic conditions at wave 2 (SEM: -0.228, 95% CI: -0.358, -0.063, *p* \< 0.010; GSEM: *b* = -0.070, 95% CI: -0.104, -0.035, *p* \< 0.001) and sum of chronic conditions at wave 3 (GSEM: *b* = -0.060, 95% CI: -0.088, -0.032, *p* \< 0.001). Results do not show support for *Hypothesis 3a*. As stated above, income at wave 1 significantly predicts sum of chronic conditions at wave 3; however, income does not significantly predict use of alternative medical systems. Therefore, use of alternative medical systems does not mediate the relationship between income and sum of chronic conditions. Results do not show support for *Hypothesis 4a* given the lack of association between income and use of alternative medical systems. 

Results show support for *Hypothesis 1b*. Education at wave 1 is positively associated with use of alternative medical systems at wave 3 (SEM: *b* = 0.013, 95% CI: 0.024, 0.029, *p* \< 0.050; GSEM: *b* = 0.157, 95% CI: 0.011, 0.303, *p* \< 0.050). Results also show support for *Hypothesis 2b*. Education at wave 1 is negatively associated with sum of chronic conditions at wave 3 (SEM: -0.168, 95% CI: -0.269, -0.060, *p* \< 0.010; GSEM: *b* = -0.035, 95% CI: -0.058, -0.012, *p* \< 0.010). Results support *Hypothesis 3b*. As stated, education at wave 1 is negatively associated with sum of chronic conditions at wave 3. Education at wave 1 is positively associated with use of alternative medical systems at wave 2 (SEM: *b* = 0.027, 95% CI: 0.013, 0.040, *p* \< 0.001; GSEM: *b* = 0.275, 95% CI: 0.142, 0.407, *p* \< 0.001). In turn, sum of chronic conditions at wave 3 is positively associated with use of alternative medical systems at wave 2 (GSEM: *b* = 0.109, 95% CI: 0.035, 0.183, *p* \< 0.010). GSEM analyses show a significant, positive indirect effect for education on chronic conditions mediated by use of alternative medical systems (*b* = 0.030, 95% CI: 0.005, 0.055, *p* \< 0.050), though the total effect is not significant. Results do not support *Hypothesis 4b*. As stated above, education at wave 1 is positively associate with use of alternative medical systems at wave 3. Education at wave 1 is negatively associated with sum of chronic conditions at wave 2 (SEM: *b* = -0.140, 95% CI: -0.245, -0.056, *p* \< 0.010; GSEM: *b* = -0.046, 95% CI: -0.073, -0.019, *p* \< 0.001). Sum of chronic conditions at wave 2 is not significantly related to use of alternative medical systems at wave 3. Therefore, the relationship between education and use of alternative medical systems is not mediated by chronic conditions.

```{r model-altmed-srh, echo = FALSE, results='hide', fig.show='hide'}
# Mediator effects - Education
altmed_W2 ~ i*Education_W1
SRH_W2 ~ j*Education_W1 
# Control for previous wave
altmed_W3 ~ altmed_W2
SRH_W3 ~ SRH_W2
# Indirect effect 
ef := e*f
gh := g*h
jf := j*f
ih := i*h
# total effect
total1 := a + (e*f)
total2 := b + (g*h)
total3 := c + (j*f)
total4 := d + (i*h)
# Controls
altmed_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + HlthInsurance_W2 + HLSelf_W2 + Spiritual_W2 + Religion_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
SRH_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
altmed_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + HlthInsurance_W3 + HLSelf_W3 + Spiritual_W3 + Religion_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
SRH_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
# Covariances
altmed_W2 ~~ SRH_W2
altmed_W3 ~~ SRH_W3
'


# Run model and get summary and fit statistics
set.seed(1234)
model.summ <- sem(model, data = path.complete, se = "bootstrap")
summary(model.summ, standardized = TRUE)
fitMeasures(model.summ, c("cfi", "rmsea", "srmr"))
#modificationindices(model.summ)

# Create object with model fit measures
fit.altmed.SRH <- lavInspect(model.summ, what = "fit")

# Create object with parameter estimates
est.altmed.SRH <- parameterEstimates(model.summ, boot.ci.type = "bca.simple", standardized = TRUE)



m <- matrix(NA, 4, 3)
m[1, 1] <- "LogIncome_W1"
m[4, 1] <- "Education_W1"
m[2, 2] <- "altmed_W2"
m[3, 2] <- "SRH_W2"
m[1, 3] <- "altmed_W3"
m[4, 3] <- "SRH_W3"

# Drop controls from path diagram
path_dia <- semptools::drop_nodes(
                object = semPlotModel(model.summ),
                nodes = c("Age_W3", "Sex_W1", "Marital_W3", "HlthInsurance_W3", "HLSelf_W3", "Spiritual_W3", "Religion_W3", "MexicanHispanic_W2", "Black_W2", "OtherRace_W2", "Age_W2", "Marital_W2", "HlthInsurance_W2", "HLSelf_W2", "Spiritual_W2", "Religion_W2"))

# Create path diagram
path_dia2 <- semPaths(path_dia, whatLabels = "std",
           sizeMan = 8,
           edge.label.cex = .8,
           edge.color = "black",
           style = "ram",
           layout = m, 
           exoCov = FALSE,
           nCharNodes = 0, nCharEdges = 0)

# Create list to rearrange positions of node edges that were blocking each other
my_position_list <- c("altmed_W3 ~ Education_W1" = .20, 
                      "SRH_W3 ~ LogIncome_W1" = .75)
# Change label position
path_dia3 <- set_edge_label_position(path_dia2, my_position_list)

path_dia4 <- change_node_label(path_dia3,
                           c(LogIncome_W1 = "Income W1",
                             Education_W1 = "Education W1",
                             altmed_W2 = "Alt. Med. Systems W2",
                             SRH_W2 = "SRH W2", 
                             altmed_W3 = "Alt. Med. Systems W3",
                             SRH_W3 = "SRH W3"),
                           label.cex = 1.1)

path_dia5 <- mark_sig(path_dia4, model.summ, alpha = c("(n.s.)" = 1.00, "*" = .05))





```

The next model investigates the relationship between SES, use of alternative medicines, and sum of chronic conditions. The path model can be seen in Figure \ref{fig:path-altmed-srh}. Results from the SEM analysis can be found in Tables \ref{tab:de-altmed-srh}, \ref{tab:ie-altmed-srh}, and \ref{tab:fit-altmed-srh}. Results from the GSEM analysis can be found in Tables \ref{tab:de-gsem-altmed-srh} and \ref{tab:ie-gsem-altmed-srh}. Most goodness of fit indices indicate good model fit (\$\\chi\$^2^(`r round(fit.altmed.SRH[4],3)`) = `r round(fit.altmed.SRH[3],3)`, *p* \< 0.001; CFI = `r round(fit.altmed.SRH[9], 3)`; TLI = `r round(fit.altmed.SRH[10],3)`; RMSEA = `r round(fit.altmed.SRH[23],3)`, SRMR = `r round(fit.altmed.SRH[29],3)`). 

Results do not support *Hypothesis 1a*. Income does not predict use of alternative medical systems at waves 2 or 3. Results support *Hypothesis 2a*. Income at wave 1 is positively associated with SRH at wave 3 (SEM: *b* = 0.105, 95% CI: 0.058, 0.153, *p* \< 0.001; GSEM: *b* = 0.105, 95% CI: 0.047, 0.164, *p* \< 0.011) and at wave 3 (SEM: *b* = 0.138, 95% CI: 0.094, 0.190, *p* \< 0.001; GSEM: *b* = 0.171, 95% CI: 0.113, 0.230, *p* \< 0.001). Results do not support *Hypothesis 3a*. While income is significantly related SRH at wave 3, the relationship is not mediated by use of alternative medical systems. Results do not support *Hypothesis 4a* given the lack of association between income and use of alternative medical systems. 

Results support *Hypothesis 1b*. Education is positively associated with use of alternative medical systems at waves 2 (SEM: *b* = 0.027, 95% CI: 0.014, 0.040, *p* \< 0.001; GSEM: *b* = 0.275, 95% CI 0.142, 0.407, *p* \< 0.001) and 3 (SEM: *b* = 0.013, 95% CI: 0.002, 0.024, *p* \< 0.050; GSEM: *b* = 0.158, 95% CI: 0.010, 0.305, *p* \< 0.050). Results also support *Hypothesis 2b*. Education at wave 1 is positively associated with SRH at waves 2 (SEM: *b* = 0.163, 95% CI: 0.014, 0.040, *p* \< 0.001; GSEM: *b* = 0.177, 95% CI: 0.133, 0.220, *p* \< 0.001)and 3 (SEM: *b* = 0.062, 95% CI: 0.025, 0.093, *p* \< 0.001; GSEM: *b* = 0.069, 95% CI: 0.025, 0.114). Results do not support *Hypothesis 3b*. Use of alternative medical systems does not mediate the relationship between education and SRH. Results do not support *Hypothesis 4b*. SRH does not mediate the relationship between education and use of alternative medical systems.

#### High Blood Pressure

```{r model-altmed-highbp, echo = FALSE, results='hide', fig.show='hide'}
model <- '
# Regressions
# Direct effect - log income 
altmed_W3 ~ a*LogIncome_W1 
HighBP_W3 ~ b*LogIncome_W1
# Direct Effect - Education
altmed_W3 ~ c*Education_W1
HighBP_W3 ~ d*Education_W1
# Mediator effects - Income 
HighBP_W2 ~ e*LogIncome_W1 
altmed_W3 ~ f*HighBP_W2
altmed_W2 ~ g*LogIncome_W1
HighBP_W3 ~ h*altmed_W2
# Mediator effects - Education
altmed_W2 ~ i*Education_W1
HighBP_W2 ~ j*Education_W1 
# Control for previous wave
altmed_W3 ~ altmed_W2
HighBP_W3 ~ HighBP_W2
# Indirect effect 
ef := e*f
gh := g*h
jf := j*f
ih := i*h
# total effect
total1 := a + (e*f)
total2 := b + (g*h)
total3 := c + (j*f)
total4 := d + (i*h)
# Controls
altmed_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + HlthInsurance_W2 + HLSelf_W2 + Spiritual_W2 + Religion_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
HighBP_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
altmed_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + HlthInsurance_W3 + HLSelf_W3 + Spiritual_W3 + Religion_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
HighBP_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
# Covariances
altmed_W2 ~~ HighBP_W2
altmed_W3 ~~ HighBP_W3
'

# Run model and get summary and fit statistics
set.seed(1234)
model.summ <- sem(model, data = path.complete, se = "bootstrap")
summary(model.summ, standardized = TRUE, fit.measures = TRUE)
fitMeasures(model.summ, c("cfi", "rmsea", "srmr"))
#modificationindices(model.summ)

# Create object with model fit measures
fit.altmed.highbp <- lavInspect(model.summ, what = "fit")

# Create object with parameter estimates
est.altmed.highbp <- parameterEstimates(model.summ, boot.ci.type = "bca.simple", standardized = TRUE)


m <- matrix(NA, 4, 3)
m[1, 1] <- "LogIncome_W1"
m[4, 1] <- "Education_W1"
m[2, 2] <- "altmed_W2"
m[3, 2] <- "HighBP_W2"
m[1, 3] <- "altmed_W3"
m[4, 3] <- "HighBP_W3"

# Drop controls from path diagram
path_dia <- semptools::drop_nodes(
                object = semPlotModel(model.summ),
                nodes = c("Age_W3", "Sex_W1", "Marital_W3", "HlthInsurance_W3", "HLSelf_W3", "Spiritual_W3", "Religion_W3", "MexicanHispanic_W2", "Black_W2", "OtherRace_W2", "Age_W2", "Marital_W2", "HlthInsurance_W2", "HLSelf_W2", "Spiritual_W2", "Religion_W2"))

# Create path diagram
path_dia2 <- semPaths(path_dia, whatLabels = "std",
           sizeMan = 8,
           edge.label.cex = .8,
           edge.color = "black",
           style = "ram",
           layout = m, 
           exoCov = FALSE,
           nCharNodes = 0, nCharEdges = 0)

# Create list to rearrange positions of node edges that were blocking each other
my_position_list <- c("altmed_W3 ~ Education_W1" = .20, 
                      "HighBP_W3 ~ LogIncome_W1" = .75)
# Change label position
path_dia3 <- set_edge_label_position(path_dia2, my_position_list)

path_dia4 <- change_node_label(path_dia3,
                           c(LogIncome_W1 = "Income W1",
                             Education_W1 = "Education W1",
                             altmed_W2 = "Alt. Med. Systems W2",
                             HighBP_W2 = "High BP W2", 
                             altmed_W3 = "Alt. Med. Systems W3",
                             HighBP_W3 = "High BP W3"),
                           label.cex = 1.1)

path_dia5 <- mark_sig(path_dia4, model.summ, alpha = c("(n.s.)" = 1.00, "*" = .05))

```

The path model representing relationships between SES, use of alternative medical systems, and high blood pressure can be seen in Figure \ref{fig:path-altmed-highbp}. Results from the SEM analysis can be found in Tables \ref{tab:de-altmed-srh}, \ref{tab:ie-altmed-srh}, and \ref{tab:fit-altmed-srh}. Results from the GSEM analysis can be found in Tables \ref{tab:de-gsem-altmed-srh} and \ref{tab:ie-gsem-altmed-srh}. Goodness of fit indices indicate good model fit (\$\\chi\$^2^(`r round(fit.altmed.highbp[4],3)`) = `r round(fit.altmed.highbp[3],3)`, *p* \< 0.001; CFI = `r round(fit.altmed.highbp[9], 3)`; TLI = `r round(fit.altmed.highbp[10],3)`; RMSEA = `r round(fit.altmed.highbp[23],3)`, SRMR = `r round(fit.altmed.highbp[29],3)`.

Results do not support *Hypothesis 1a*. Income does not significantly predict use of alternative medical systems. Results provide weak support for *Hypothesis 2a*. Income at wave 1 is negatively associated with having high blood pressure at wave 2 in the SEM analysis (SEM: *b* = -0.026, 95% CI: -0.049, -0.002, *p* \< 0.050). Given the lack of association between income and high blood pressure, results do not support *Hypothesis 3a*. Given the lack of association between income and use of alternative medical systems, results do not support *Hypothesis 4a*. 

Results support *Hypothesis 1b*. Education is positively associated with use of alternative medical systems at wave 2 (SEM: *b* = 0.027, 95% CI: 0.014, 0.040, *p* \< 0.001; GSEM: *b* = 0.275, 95% CI: 0.142, 0.407, *p* \< 0.001) and wave 3 (GSEM: *b* = 0.148, 95% CI: 0.002, 0.295, *p* \< 0.050). Results support *Hypothesis 2b*. Education at wave 1 is negatively related to having high blood pressure at wave 2 (SEM: *b* = -0.024, 95% CI: -0.040, -0.008, *p* \< 0.010; GSEM: *b* = -0.115, 95% CI: -0.210, -0.021, *p* \< 0.050). Results do not support *Hypothesis 3b*. Education at wave 1 is not significantly related to high blood pressure at wave 3, and use of alternative medical systems is not significantly related to high blood pressure. Results do not support *Hypothesis 4b*. As stated above, education is positively associated with use of alternative medical systems at wave 3. Education is also negatively related to high blood pressure at wave 2. In the GSEM analysis, high blood pressure at wave 2 is negatively related to use of alternative medical systems at wave 3 (GSEM: *b* = -0.469, 95% CI: -0.872, -0.651, *p* \< 0.050). Further analyses show that while the total effect of education on alternative medical systems mediated by high blood pressure is statistically significant (GSEM: *b* = 0.202, 95% CI: 0.044, 0.361, *p* \< 0.050).

#### Diabetes 

```{r model-altmed-diabetes, echo = FALSE, results='hide', fig.show='hide'}
model <- '
# Regressions
# Direct effect - log income 
altmed_W3 ~ a*LogIncome_W1 
Diabetes_W3 ~ b*LogIncome_W1
# Direct Effect - Education
altmed_W3 ~ c*Education_W1
Diabetes_W3 ~ d*Education_W1
# Mediator effects - Income 
Diabetes_W2 ~ e*LogIncome_W1 
altmed_W3 ~ f*Diabetes_W2
altmed_W2 ~ g*LogIncome_W1
Diabetes_W3 ~ h*altmed_W2
# Mediator effects - Education
altmed_W2 ~ i*Education_W1
Diabetes_W2 ~ j*Education_W1 
# Control for previous wave
altmed_W3 ~ altmed_W2
Diabetes_W3 ~ Diabetes_W2
# Indirect effect 
ef := e*f
gh := g*h
jf := j*f
ih := i*h
# total effect
total1 := a + (e*f)
total2 := b + (g*h)
total3 := c + (j*f)
total4 := d + (i*h)
# Controls
altmed_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + HlthInsurance_W2 + HLSelf_W2 + Spiritual_W2 + Religion_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
Diabetes_W2 ~ Sex_W1 + Age_W2 + Marital_W2 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
altmed_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + HlthInsurance_W3 + HLSelf_W3 + Spiritual_W3 + Religion_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
Diabetes_W3 ~ Age_W3 + Sex_W1 + Marital_W3 + MexicanHispanic_W2 + Black_W2 + OtherRace_W2
# Covariances
altmed_W2 ~~ Diabetes_W2
altmed_W3 ~~ Diabetes_W3
'

# Run model and get summary and fit statistics
set.seed(1234)
model.summ <- sem(model, data = path.complete, se = "bootstrap")
summary(model.summ, standardized = TRUE, fit.measures = TRUE)
fitMeasures(model.summ, c("cfi", "rmsea", "srmr"))
#modificationindices(model.summ)

# Create object with model fit measures
fit.altmed.diabetes <- lavInspect(model.summ, what = "fit")

# Create object with parameter estimates
est.altmed.diabetes <- parameterEstimates(model.summ, boot.ci.type = "bca.simple", standardized = TRUE)


m <- matrix(NA, 4, 3)
m[1, 1] <- "LogIncome_W1"
m[4, 1] <- "Education_W1"
m[2, 2] <- "altmed_W2"
m[3, 2] <- "Diabetes_W2"
m[1, 3] <- "altmed_W3"
m[4, 3] <- "Diabetes_W3"

# Drop controls from path diagram
path_dia <- semptools::drop_nodes(
                object = semPlotModel(model.summ),
                nodes = c("Age_W3", "Sex_W1", "Marital_W3", "HlthInsurance_W3", "HLSelf_W3", "Spiritual_W3", "Religion_W3", "MexicanHispanic_W2", "Black_W2", "OtherRace_W2", "Age_W2", "Marital_W2", "HlthInsurance_W2", "HLSelf_W2", "Spiritual_W2", "Religion_W2"))

# Create path diagram
path_dia2 <- semPaths(path_dia, whatLabels = "std",
           sizeMan = 8,
           edge.label.cex = .8,
           edge.color = "black",
           style = "ram",
           layout = m, 
           exoCov = FALSE,
           nCharNodes = 0, nCharEdges = 0)

# Create list to rearrange positions of node edges that were blocking each other
my_position_list <- c("altmed_W3 ~ Education_W1" = .20, 
                      "Diabetes_W3 ~ LogIncome_W1" = .75)
# Change label position
path_dia3 <- set_edge_label_position(path_dia2, my_position_list)

path_dia4 <- change_node_label(path_dia3,
                           c(LogIncome_W1 = "Income W1",
                             Education_W1 = "Education W1",
                             altmed_W2 = "Alt. Med. Systems W2",
                             Diabetes_W2 = "Diabetes W2", 
                             altmed_W3 = "Alt. Med. Systems W3",
                             Diabetes_W3 = "Diabetes W3"),
                           label.cex = 1.1)

path_dia5 <- mark_sig(path_dia4, model.summ, alpha = c("(n.s.)" = 1.00, "*" = .05))

```

A path model representing the relationships between SES, use of alternative medical systems, and diabetes can be found in Figure \ref{fig:path-altmed-diabetes}. Results from the SEM analysis can be found in Tables \ref{tab:de-altmed-diabetes}, \ref{tab:ie-altmed-diabetes}, and \ref{tab:fit-altmed-diabetes}. Results from the GSEM analysis can be found in Tables \ref{tab:de-gsem-altmed-diabetes} and \ref{tab:ie-gsem-altmed-diabetes}. Model fit indices indicate good model fit (CFI = `r round(fit.altmed.diabetes[9], 3)`; TLI = `r round(fit.altmed.diabetes[10], 3)`; RMSEA = `r round(fit.altmed.diabetes[23],3)`; SRMR = `r round(fit.altmed.diabetes[29],3)`; \$\\chi\$^2^(`r round(fit.altmed.diabetes[4], 3)`)=`r round(fit.altmed.diabetes[3], 3)`, *p* \<.001.).

Results do not support *Hypothesis 1a*. Income is not significantly related to use of alternative medical systems. Results also do not support *Hypothesis 2a*. Income is not significantly related to diabetes. Lack of association also indicates lack of support for *Hypotheses 3a* and *4a*. 

Results support *Hypothesis 1b*. Education is positively related to use of alternative medical systems at wave 2 (SEM: *b* = 0.027, 95% CI: 0.014, 0.040, *p* \< 0.001; GSEM: *b* = 0.275, 95% CI: 0.142, 0.407, *p* \< 0.001) and wave 3 (SEM: *b* = 0.012, 95% CI: 0.001, 0.023, *p* \< 0.050; GSEM: *b* = 0.153, 95% CI: 0.007, 0.300, *p* \< 0.050). Results support *Hypothesis 2b*. Education at wave 1 is negatively associated with diabetes at wave 3 (SEM: -0.016, 95% CI: -0.025, -0.003, *p* \< 0.010; GSEM: *b* = -0.206, 95% CI: -0.360, -0.051, *p* \< 0.010). Results do not support *Hypothesis 3b*. As stated, education is negatively associated with diabetes at wave 3. Education is positively associated with use of alternative medical systems at wave 2. Use of alternative medical systems at wave 2 does not predict diabetes diagnosis at wave 3. Results do not support *Hypothesis 4b*. While education is significantly related to use of alternative medical systems at wave 3, this relationship is not mediated by diabetes diagnosis.
